wikitext.*:
[[File:Letter to Mr Britten.jpg|thumb]]
On [[11 November]] [[1956]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|a letter]] to a Mr Britten'''.<ref name=TS>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.facebook.com/groups/TheTolkienSociety.EducationalCharity/permalink/10154958294156068/|articlename=Tolkien Society Facebook group discussion|dated=|website=FB|accessed=4 April 2017}}</ref><ref name=BBC>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b08ll5zq|articlename=BBC Caversham Park 1 (aired 2 April 2017; ca. 15 min. mark.)|dated=2 April 2017|website=[http://www.bbc.co.uk/ bbc.co.uk]|accessed=2 April 2017}}</ref>

*'''Contents:''' Among topics included, the letter discusses [[Gimli]] and [[Legolas]], and on "the top of one page Tolkien mentions the nomenclature regarding names for places in the [[Shire]]" apparently "crediting [[Christopher Tolkien|Christopher]] for one or more of them, explaining that it was Christopher who drew the map". Further, at "the bottom of the same page, JRR expresses his delight at a question regarding the verse [[Oliphaunt (poem)|''Oliphaunt'']], saying that almost none of the reviewers had mentioned his poetry; except [[W.H. Auden|Auden]]".<ref name=TS/><ref name=BBC/>
*'''Description:''' Hand-written letter.<ref name=TS/><ref name=BBC/>
